CSSFlex-direction.summary: The flex-direction CSS property sets how flex items are placed in the flex container defining the main axis and the direction (normal or reversed).

remarks.para: Note that the values row and row-reverse are affected by the directionality of the flex container. If its dir attribute is ltr, row represents the horizontal axis oriented from the left to the right, and row-reverse from the right to the left; if the dir attribute is rtl, row represents the axis oriented from the right to the left, and row-reverse from the left to the right.
